bug.short_desc: totem (or gstreamer) misses (or malfunction when trying to find) main codes ...

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
most of the av codecs: DTS decoder, MPEG-4 ACC, Windows Media Audio 7 decoder, Windows Media Video 8 screen decoder, ....
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
streamer-0.10.36-14.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer1-1.8.0-1.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer1-debuginfo-1.6.1-1.fc23.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-bad-free-1.8.0-1.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-bad-free-debuginfo-1.6.1-2.fc23.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-bad-free-extras-1.8.0-1.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-base-1.8.0-1.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-base-debuginfo-1.6.1-1.fc23.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-good-1.8.0-1.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-good-debuginfo-1.6.1-1.fc23.x86_64 gstreamer1-plugins-ugly-1.6.3-1.fc23.x86_64 gstreamer1-vaapi-0.6.1-1.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-devel-0.10.36-14.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-bad-free-0.10.23-32.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-bad-free-devel-0.10.23-32.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-bad-free-devel-docs-0.10.23-32.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-bad-free-extras-0.10.23-32.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-base-0.10.36-14.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-base-devel-0.10.36-14.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-base-devel-docs-0.10.36-14.fc24.noarch gstreamer-plugins-base-tools-0.10.36-14.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-espeak-0.4.0-9.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-fc-0.2-12.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-good-0.10.31-16.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-plugins-good-devel-docs-0.10.31-16.fc24.noarch gstreamer-plugins-good-extras-0.10.31-16.fc24.x86_64 gstreamer-tools-0.10.36-14.fc24.x86_64 totem-3.20.0-1.fc24.x86_64 totem-debuginfo-3.18.1-1.fc23.x86_64 totem-nautilus-3.20.0-1.fc24.x86_64 totem-pl-parser-3.10.6-2.fc24.x86_64 totem-pl-parser-debuginfo-3.10.5-2.fc23.x86_64
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results:
Expected results:
Additional info:

You probably need some codecs not available to Fedora for legal reasons. This is not totem's fault. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/PackageKit_Items_Not_Found#Missing_Codec for details.
Once rpmfusion repositories for Fedora 24 are online you can get the codecs from there.

I can confirm this bug when `gstreamer1-vaapi` is installed. When removed, Totem is able to play the videos as expected.
It may be related to:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1309446

(In reply to Peque from comment #2) > I can confirm this bug when `gstreamer1-vaapi` is installed. When removed, > Totem is able to play the videos as expected. > > It may be related to: > > https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1309446
good tip !
dnf remove gstreamer1-vaapi
fixes intel_do_flush_locked failed: No such file or directory, for me !
Thanks.
AFAIK this looks like the same question of bug #1309446, and should be fixed now !

this is reported as Fixed, I test myself and seems so, since nobody reply , I'm closing this bug , please reopen it if it not fixed.
Thanks.

this is reported as Fixed, I test myself and seems so, since nobody reply , I'm closing this bug , please reopen it if it not fixed.
Thanks.
